package.description:
This tutorial implements a control graph aimed at grasping a ball detected by vision on humanoid robot HRP2. When the ball is hold at a given position with respect to robot waist, the robot triggers a motion arm to catch the ball. The tutorial is specific to HRP-2 control architecture but can be reasonably extended to any other humanoid robot running ROS.
The motion is generated by the hierarchical kinematic task solver "Stack of Tasks" wrapped into ROS via dynamic_graph_bridge.
